9 Theming

The Egeo Base Framework was built thinking in theming from the first time. All components provides a series of properties with default values that can be changed using Sass.

9.1 How to create a theme

To create a theme the only thing you must to do is to create a Sass part file and include there all the properties you want to customize and are provided by the component. The ones you don't include in the file will be replaced by the default value ones.

It is also possible, and even advisable, to create an own micro-architecture for the theme if it is too complex to be included in one unique file.

Creating a theme

The best way to create a theme is creating a new file inside the /theme/ folder, called _themes.mythemename.scss. The underscore is to indicate that is a Sass part file, and the rest is a convention naming.

Inside the file we can begin to create our theme customizing the values provided by the components. For example:

$egeo-c-label---background: transparent;
$egeo-c-label---border: 0;
$egeo-c-label---box-shadow: none;
$egeo-c-label---color: egeo-get-color(a1);
$egeo-c-label---font-size: egeo-get-font-size(body_xxsmall);
$egeo-c-label---font-style: null;

$egeo-c-label__optional-mark---color: egeo-get-color(a1);
$egeo-c-label__optional-mark---content: '(optional)';
$egeo-c-label__optional-mark---font-style: null;

$egeo-c-label__icon---color: egeo-get-color(n5);
$egeo-c-label__icon---font-size: egeo-get-font-size(body_xsmall);

If we want to create a complex architecture for the theme, we should remember that we want to use @import directive.

@import '/mythemename/label';
@import '/mythemename/header';
@import '/mythemename/icon';
...

How to import the theme in Egeo

To import the theme inside Egeo to be applied, is needed to do it just after the tools importing as is shown below:

@import 'tools/tools.log';

@import 'settings/settings';
@import 'settings/settings.colors';
@import 'settings/settings.fonts';
@import 'settings/settings.layers';
@import 'settings/settings.icons';
@import 'settings/settings.typography';

@import 'tools/tools.log';
@import 'tools/tools.maps';
@import 'tools/tools.colors';
@import 'tools/tools.typography';
@import 'tools/tools.layers';

@import 'themes/theme.mythemename';

@import 'utils/utils.alignments';
@import 'utils/utils.clearfix';
@import 'utils/utils.floats';
@import 'utils/utils.text';

@import 'objects/media/objects.media';
@import 'objects/box-shadow/objects.box-shadow';

@import 'components/component/components.component';
@import 'components/app/components.app';
...
